DOC.brief_summary: To examine efficacy continued administration rebamipide follow bacteria eradication therapy patient H. pylori-positive active gastric ulcer placebo-controlled , double-blind study
DOC.brief_title: Post-Marketing Clinical Study Rebamipide Patients With Gastric Ulcer
DOC.criteria: 1 . Patients age 20 year old time consent 2 . H. pyloripositive patient meet follow criterion : • Assessed H. pyloripositive rapid urease test and/or 13Curea breath test prestudy examination , • Assessed H. pyloriantibodypositive urinebased test obtain inform consent 3 . Patients endoscopically diagnose gastric ulcer meeting follow criterion : • Active ( A1 A2stage Sakita/Miwa classification） , • Solitary , • Longitudinal diameter : > 5 mm 4 . Patients receive proton pump inhibitor ( PPIs ) , antibacterial agent , antiprotozoal agent within 1 week prior endoscopy 1 . Patients previously receive H. pylori eradication therapy 2 . Patients acute gastric ulcer 3 . Patients linear ulcer 4 . Patients complication duodenal ulcer ( exclude cicatrix ) 5 . Patients undergone upperGI tract vagal nerve resection 6 . Patients unsuitable pharmacotherapy , e.g. , perforation pyloric stenosis 7 . Patients gastric ulcer consider likely induce massive hemorrhage ( e.g. , obviously expose blood vessel lesion site ) 8 . Patients history amoxicillin shock 9 . Patients infectious mononucleosis 10 . Patients severe renal disorder 11 . Patients history hypersensitivity penicillin , clarithromycin , lansoprazole , rebamipide 12 . Patients treat drug contraindicate clarithromycin , terfenadine , cisapride , pimozide 13 . Patients pregnant , possibly pregnant , lactating , desire become pregnant study 14 . Patients otherwise judged inappropriate inclusion study investigator subinvestigator
